source.b43a3d41:
# SF Salaries Exercise 

This exercise was provided in a python course on Udemy by Jose Partila, using the [SF Salaries Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/kaggle/sf-salaries) from Kaggle! The solutions are appended here for beginers who may be interested in python for data analytics. Just follow along with the questions and solutions.
source.b384e2b3: ** How many Job Titles were represented by only one person in 2013? (e.g. Job Titles with only one occurence in 2013?) **
source.a9e4f668: ** How many unique job titles are there? **
source.f3203f14: ** What is the highest amount of OvertimePay in the dataset ? **
source.330b3bc8: ** How much does JOSEPH DRISCOLL make (including benefits)? **
source.2083ce08: Which are the top 5 most popular job?
source.a59402d9: ** What is the job title of  JOSEPH DRISCOLL ? Note: Use all caps, otherwise you may get an answer that doesn't match up (there is also a lowercase Joseph Driscoll). **
